arts.ttl: 'Maddison dictates the game' - how Man Utd gave Spurs too much space
arts.sum: Match Of The Day 2 pundits Ashley Williams and Micah Richards explain how Manchester United made it too easy for Tottenham as the hosts won 1-0.

arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou reveals triple Tottenham injury concern as Kevin Danso fitness update delivered
arts.sum: Ange Postecoglou reveals that three Tottenham Hotspur players picked up knocks in their 1-0 Premier League triumph over Manchester United on Sunday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou joins exclusive club as Tottenham achieve club Premier League first in Man United victory
arts.sum: Ange Postecoglou joins an exclusive club of managers and also led Tottenham Hotspur to a Premier League first in their 1-0 success over Manchester United on Sunday.
It‚Äôs only one game, but I thought today was an important game if we were going to start that progress. We‚Äôre in the Europa League this year and we‚Äôve got an opportunity there to make an impact.

arts.ttl: Postecoglou: Vicario and Maddison stood up for us
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur head coach Ange Postecoglou praised Guglielmo Vicario and James Maddison after the pair returned from injury to play key roles in Sunday's 1-0 win over Manchester United. It was Maddison's fourth goal in his last four Premier League starts, with the matchwinner delighted to respond after receiving some criticism earlier this week.

arts.ttl: Analysis: Revitalised Spurs expose a Man Utd midfield missing youthful energy
arts.sum: Amad ‚Äì who has scored or assisted eight of United‚Äôs 16 league goals under Amorim (50 pr cent) - is expected to miss the rest of the season, leaving United reliant upon Alejandro Garnacho, a forward they were open to selling in January, and Zirkzee. Tottenham Hotspur are leaving an injury crisis just as Manchester United are entering theirs and, on the evidence of the first half in particular, that means Spurs are ready to shoot up the table and United, if it‚Äôs even possible, falling deeper into trouble.

arts.ttl: Amorim vows to stick with beliefs after Manchester United‚Äôs loss at Tottenham
arts.athr: Ed Aarons at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium
arts.sum: ‚ÄòWe need to stop focusing on big picture. Just next game‚Äô Maddison scores winner to ease pressure on Postecoglou Ruben Amorim has insisted that he will ‚Äústick with my beliefs‚Äù after watching his injury-hit Manchester United side endure a 12th Premier League defeat of the campaign that leaves them 15th in the table. A first-half goal from James Maddison, who celebrated by putting his finger to his lips in response to criticism he received last week from Roy Keane, sealed Tottenham‚Äôs first win at home in the Premier League since they beat Aston Villa here in November. On his return from injury, Guglielmo Vicario produced a brilliant save to deny an Alejandro Garnacho shot in the second half. Continue reading...

arts.sum: Djed Spence claimed his second consecutive Premier League Man of the Match award for his impressive display against Manchester United. Tottenham fans hailed Spence‚Äôs performance...

arts.ttl: Tottenham have now done something vs Man United for the first time in Premier League history after 1-0 win
In a Jeremy Kyle Cl√°sico, Spurs come out on top in theatre of dysfunction | Barney Ronay
arts.athr: Barney Ronay at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium
arts.sum: As Tottenham fans protest, Manchester United still look like they are learning tactics from a leaflet There was a gripping moment before kickoff outside the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, as the Levy Out supporters‚Äô march reached its final stop and a single protester stationed himself in its path holding up a Levy In sign, Tiananmen Square-style, a lone show of human will in the path of history. The sign was snatched from his hand. But wait! He pulled out another one. A minor scuffle ensued. Police intervened. The marchers cheered, then milled off to their high-priced seats inside this spectacular mega-drome, monument to Levy‚Äôs commercial brilliance, there to watch their team take on Manchester United, the great ailing zombified giant of English football. Continue reading...
